abstract: The Dow closed down by more than 240 points after a flurry of disappointing news about several major financial institutions.
snippet: The Dow closed down by more than 240 points after a flurry of disappointing news about several major financial institutions.
lead_paragraph: Shares that went up on Friday plummeted on Monday. The markets dropped after a flurry of disappointing news about several major financial institutions.

headline.main: Worries About Major Banks Drag Down the Market
headline.print_headline: Worries About Major Banks Drag Down the Market

abstract: SunTrust Banks shares fell on Monday as a Citigroup analyst threw cold water on speculation that the Southeastern bank may be acquired by a larger player.
snippet: SunTrust Banks shares fell on Monday as a Citigroup analyst threw cold water on speculation that the Southeastern bank may be acquired by a larger player.
lead_paragraph: The markets plummeted on Monday — the Dow Jones industrial average falling more than 200 points, or nearly 2 percent — with financial stocks again leading the way. Among the culprits was SunTrust Banks, the troubled Atlanta-based lender that must cope with the minefield that is the Southeast’s housing market.

headline.main: SunTrust Falls Amid Pessimism Over a Potential Deal
